text: xenophobia violence seems to be
spreading among foreign nationals here
in gemston east of Johannesburg most
shopkeepers from countries like Ethiopia
Somalia and other parts of Africa have
closed their businesses in anticipation
of looting as you can see here the
police are protecting properties
businesses shops that belong to African
migrants they said that they were
attacked last night precisely because
they are not South Africans I'm worried
I'm scared I know how to protect myself
because most most of us here we are
citizen already at least five people
were killed including two South Africans
since the violence began last week
locals who are behind the rioting have
said foreign nationals are taking their
jobs and opportunities
in the eastern coastal city of Durban a
March began by some 10,000 South
Africans who are calling for an end to
the attacks the chatsworth spots filled
south of devon has been turned into a
makeshift refugee camp here you will
find families from Zimbabwe Malawi
Mozambique and many others from the rest
of Africa they told us that they escaped
with the mega belongings they could
salvage when the looters came to speak
to our countries maybe later because we
end up dying I think South Africa is a
better country because they are killing
us for no reason what is happening in
our country is not acceptable President
Jacob Zuma has been on national
television condemning the senseless
violence and he's expected to address
Parliament on the current situation in
2008 at least 62 people died after the
same chaos swept the country Milton
Ghazi BBC News Johannesburg
